title: CCM Care Plan Review
author: Vanier, Michael
text: Reviewed patient's CCM Care plan. Updated their medications as per the patients original treatment plan. Attempted to contact patient to follow-up to confirm medication change as prescribed by specialist, located them on third attempt, patient was made aware and has continued to take medications correctly. No other issues were reported.

amendments.title: CCM Care Plan Review
amendments.author: Vanier, Michael
amendments.text: Received a call from the patient's caregiver indicating that they were concerned about the medication change. After reviewing previous notes, it was decided to consult with specialist before continuing medication change.

amendments.title: CCM Care Plan Review
amendments.author: Vanier, Michael
amendments.text: Consulted with specialist, who indicated no changes to current medication regimen. Informed patient.

title: Review of Medication changes
author: Vanier, Michael
text: Following hospital discharge, the patient's medication regime needs to be updated to eventually return to pre-hospitalization doses. Based on the provider's documentation, made necessary updates to patient's medications. Attempted to contact patient, unsuccessful as of today, will attempt again within 24 hours.

amendments.title: CCM Care Plan Review
amendments.author: Vanier, Michael
amendments.text: Contacted patient on 21APR2021 to update on progress, patient understood the impact of treatment, no additional questions asked.

title: At Risk Observation Report
author: Vanier, Michael
text: Received a notification for an At Risk observation this morning. This is attributed to the patient experiencing an infection for which they are receiving treatment, and no further action is necessary at the moment.

amendments.title: RPM Updates
amendments.author: Vanier, Michael
amendments.text: Reviewed patient's medication as per pharmacist's request, noted changes to antimicrobial treatment. Changes to patient instructions will be updated.

amendments.title: RPM Updates
amendments.author: Vanier, Michael
amendments.text: Called patient to inform them of changes in antimicrobial treatment, patient understood changes in dosage and frequency, no impact on rest of treatment or medication plan.

amendments.title: RPM Updates
amendments.author: Vanier, Michael
amendments.text: Caregiver returned call to clarify an issue with treatment plan, informed care giver of the same information that was provided to the patient, no frther questions were asked.

amendments.title: RPM Updates
amendments.author: Vanier, Michael
amendments.text: Reviewed patient progress compared to last week, will inform dietitian to take this into consideration for their upcoming appointment.

title: Review of patient Test Results
author: Vanier, Michael
text: Received patient's test results from the lab. All values tested are within ranges expected. No changes to treatment plan will be indicated. Contacted patient by phone, the patient was informed of their lab results and their interpretation. No further action is necessary.

title: Monthly Patient Contact
author: Vanier, Michael
text: Contacted the patient by telephone, communicated with them successfuly on second attempt. Reviewed the patient's observation trends, informed them that there has been a consistent increase in blood pressure, and indicated that if persistent, medications will need to be updated. Daily adherence has been maintained. No other issues or further changes to treatment plan.

title: Patient Reported Fall
author: Vanier, Michael
text: Received a call from the patient's daughter informing us that the patient had fallen from a chair the night before. The patient received support from their daugher immediately and sustained no apparent injuries. The patient and daughter decided not to go to emergency care, since there were no apparent injuries or discomfort. Confirmed with daughter that the patient should remain under observation and to go to emergency care if they experience any pain, dizziness, if they present wounds or any other relevant symptom.
